greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of rooted loopless planar maps with n edges, k faces and no isthmuses, n >= 0, k = 1..n+1.
comment: The number of vertices is n + 2 - k.

For k >= 2, columns k without the initial zero term is a polynomial of degree 3*(k-2). This is because adding a face can increase the number of vertices whose degree is greater than two by at most two.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (rows 0..50)
T. R. S. Walsh and A. B. Lehman, Counting rooted maps by genus. III: Nonseparable maps, J. Combinatorial Theory Ser. B 18 (1975), 222-259, Table VIa.
formula: G.f.: A(x,y) satisfies A(x,y) = G(x*A(x,y)^2,y) where G(x,y) = 1 + x*B(x,y) and B(x,y) is the g.f. of A082680.
mathematica: H[n_] := With[{g = 1 + x*G[n - 1, y]}, Sqrt[InverseSeries[x/g^2 + O[x]^(n + 1), x]/x]];
Join[{{1}, {0, 0}}, Append[CoefficientList[#, y], 0]& /@ CoefficientList[ H[11], x][[3;;]]] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 15 2021, after _Andrew Howroyd_ *)
program: (PARI) \\ here G(n,y) gives A082680 as g.f.
H(n)={my(g=1+x*G(n-1, y), v=Vec(sqrt(serreverse(x/g^2)/x))); vector(#v, n, Vecrev(v[n], n))}
xref: Columns (and diagonals) are A006416, A006417, A006418.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 01 2021
